column7:
in august 2016 i flew with air india from melbourne to frankfurt via new delhi. well, this is quite a long journey; and the prospect of having to hang around at indira gandhi international airport for 19 hours waiting for the connecting flight, could easily deter one from booking with air india, right? BUT: the airfare was so cheap that even with paying for a stay at the holiday inn express in terminal 3 (transit area!) it was a very reasonable - and because of the break - very enjoyable trip.

the most important thing during the flight itself was (#1) excellent leg room. the second good thing (#2) was the very nice (although and as to be expected, a bit spicy) food. the third treat (#3) was the inflight entertainment selection - including yoga and indian cooking videos and a highly recommendable beautifully dramatized (abridged) audio version of mahatma gandhi's autobiography 'the story of my experiments with truth' (i wish i could find this particular one on the internet). # 4 would be that all flights were on time.

what i liked less - even as the airline seems to be very proud of it - is one feature of the B787 dreamliner: the dimmable windows instead of pull-down shutters. it is not that the feature itself is the problem, but that very early in the flight the staff already dimmed down the windows in the whole plane, no matter what time of the day! i found this highly annoying for two reasons: first of all, it messes even more with time (and related light/dark) differences. second, because i LOVE taking pictures during flights (and i am certainly not the only one to do so), i choose my window seat carefully in regards to being able to include a bit of the wing in some of the images to frame them, and most important, which side of the plane i would be able to witness a sunrise or sunset or see any beautiful mountain ranges, deserts, islands or other sights of interest in the areas over which we would be flying. now, when calling for the stewardess, she said she can certainly unlock my window dimmer so that i can regulate it myself, which saved my mood and allowed me to take breathtaking images once again... (on the longer leg of the return flight i sat in an over-crowded plane in a place where the dimmer happened to be broken... no pictures... but as this is not a main concern for most people, i rather focus on - and review - the good experience;-)

I had high expectations for this segment of a round-the-world trip my husband and I were taking, based on my excellent history of flights with Air India years ago. Instead, this flight proved to be the worst of our journey. Indeed, I would put it near the bottom of all the airlines that I've been on during decades of flying.

The plane was scheduled to depart from Bahrain, en route to New Delhi India, at 11 p.m. Close to boarding time, we learned that there would be an hour's delay with no reason given. We went to wait in a small airlines lounge, which became uncomfortably crowded with standing room only. Eventually the delay got extended (still no explanation) and the plane finally departed at 2 a.m., three hours late.

As we boarded the plane, the condition of the exterior indicated no pride of ownership. The Airbus 319 had been sloppily painted, an indication of poor upkeep that I had never seen on any other carrier before. This situation did not improve inside. The Business Class cabin offered soiled seats that looked so unappealing that I wished I carried a towel with me to offer protection. As soon as I sat down, I noted the overflowing seat pockets on the back of the seats in front of us. Trash included old newspapers and candy wrappers. After the plane took off, I tried to recline my seat, only to find that it was broken.

Extremely tired and definitely not hungry, both my husband and I declined the meal service, so I cannot comment on that. The plane made the strangest noises throughout the 3.5-hour flight, creaking, groaning and causing me to feel anxious, though I am usually a calm flier. As a result, I could not sleep. When I went to use the Business Class restroom, I noted the two flight attendants dozing. My shoes stuck to the restroom floor -- literally -- making loud crackling noises when I moved around, but that didn't awaken staff.

We arrived too late to make a connecting flight to Jaipur, which we had allowed almost 4 hours to do. So we waited for 3 hours in the airport at a wonderfully clean Starbucks with a pristine restroom before we were able to take to the air again.

I had a very bad experience with AI, have narrated the complete story below (long read not necessary) my suggestions for fellow travelers would be not to rely upon Air India with tight schedules or connecting flights ... and even if you go for it and anything happens dont waste your energies on hoping some support or help .. rather plan for your own self

thanks

this horrified tale is my firsthand experience during our family trip (me, my wife and 4 ys old son) to hyderabad from jodhpur on 7th April. We had booked for IA flight jodhpur to mumbai AI 646 and connecting flight AI 965 from mumbai to hyd for 7th April.

I had done the webcheckin for our seats even for the mumbai - hyd sector. when we reached at the jodhpur airport upon seeing the boarding pass we realised the onward flight from mumbai to hyderbad has been rescheduled to next day. (obviously no one informed us till then). Since my family was travelling to attend a family engagement in the evening of 7th, the next day flight made no sense hence we requested the AI executives at jodhpur to either cancel the tickets or make arrangements in another flight. The AI jodhpur did connect to their counterparts in mumbai and spoke with someone by name Stefan who assured that we shall be provided any alternate flight either AI or Jet for mumbai to hyd so that we can reach hyd by the evening hence should continue with our travel to mumbai and were asked to reach to the customer service desk in mumbai who would make necessary arrangements (a message was already sent)

At mumbai we went to the customer service desk and we were guided to one Ms Rama, who after keeping us waiting for 15 min and upon our multiple requests spoke with someone and then issued us tickets and asked us to rush in towards the boarding gate no 50 as she said the flight was about to leave. We again checked in our bag and ran towards the boarding gates .. (since it was the international airport, we had to run towards the boarding gates as it was a very long distance. upon reaching the boarding gate no 50 the AI staff informed that the onboarding flight is for jeddah and the flight to hyd is yet to be announced and we were asked to wait.

We sat near the boarding gates .. it was around 3.30 pm by then. After waiting for about an hour or so, and trying to figure out the flight schedule i just noticed that the boarding pass issued to me altough dated 7th of April has a flight timing of 04.00 hours which obviously refers to morning 4 am and thanks to the urgency shown by Ms Rama i didnt notice it when collected the boarding pass and assumed it for 4 pm evening.

I immediately contacted an AI official near the boading gate Mr. Kumar and narrated our story, he tried to help us by making a few calls and then explained that the lady has done mistake in issuing the boarding passes and she has given you boarding passes for the same flight which is suppose to leave tomorrow (8th April) and erroneously the date mentioned is for today (7th April). He then asked us to go again to the counter and ask for a new boarding pass.

we left, then were caught by the customs officers (rightly so) ... then again the whole story was narrated to them. They also sympathized, but said they cant let us go back from the immigration zone unless AI officers come here. They called AI officers ... after waiting for about 15-20 min AI officers turned up and then they explained the situation did some notings .. cancelled our boarding passes and then guided us again to the counters .... so again after a long walk back ... (by this time our baby had already gone restless and with lots of efforts we could manage to walk him back till the counters)

We reached back to the counter at 6.00 pm and again met Ms Rama ... i told her my agony and complained who could she issue a wrong boarding pass .. for the same flight which is leaving tomorrow .. that too after informing you the complete story ... to my surprise inspite of apologizing for the mix up and the problem faced by us, she started misbehaving and she said .... "i did what i was told to you and it is your mistake that you came to my counter, this is a domestic counter your ticket is in the international flight, you should have gone to the international counter" .... i was stunned with the response and was so upset and wanted to give her back on her face for the rude, in-appropriate and irresponsible behavior .... may be my chivalry stopped me and the fact that i was perturbed by my child's agony that i decided just to move back and go to the international counter ( altough it did occur to me then, that may be the recent incident involving trashing of an AI staff by a politician for some seat issue could have been justified at some level - unfortunately in a democratic set-up only politicians have the luxury to react that way ... a common man can just suffer)

i then moved to the international counter it was 6.15 by then. I met Mr. Kailash at the counter. He was a soft spoken person, listed patiently to the whole story and apologized for the inconvenience and promised us to help us, We waited for about 15-20 min and at about 6.30 pm he came back and said, i have spoken to my boss and also spoken with the duty manager (he named Mr. Revan and Mr. Gaikwad) and they have authorised him to book us into the next available flight, but since no other flight is available we can put us into the 10 pm flight (AI 050) for Hyderabad, i requested that i was promised any other airlines if AI is not available so that i can reach hyd on time .. but Mr. Kailash mentioned that no other flights are available so you have the choice to either take this flight or take the morning flight and stay at mumbai. ... obviously our plan to attend the family function was gone atleast i was relieved that we can reach hyd by the night and i shall be able to attend a business conference at morning 10 am, hence agreed for the AI 050 flight. ( i was a guest speaker at the Hyd RenewX - conference on renewable energy and was speaker participants in a panel discussion scheduled for 10 am on 8th April)

Since my child was exhausted and so were we .. we decided to take the night flight and may be relax at the airport till then. I asked Mr. kailash to provide us atleast a lounge access so that we can relax till we waitup for the next flight. To which he refused as there is no such policy :-( ... anyhow we decided to manage things on our own and asked Mr. Kailash to issue boarding passes for the 10 pm flight and this is when we inquired about our checked in baggages which Ms Rama has taken from us earlier in the afternoon.

Mr. Kailash inquired about the bags and he said ... he has already cordinated and the bags are being retreived and they will be put AI 050 aircraft so we should not worry and proceed towards security check.

We took the boarding passes at about 6.50 and proceeded for the security check.. hoping that the things are now sorted and it was just a bad day ... to be forgotten.

But AI had other plans for us, we reached at the boarding zone at about 9.30 pm but to our dismay flight for hyd was yet to be announced. We kept on waiting near the boarding gate hoping for some info from the officials as to the flight status ,,,,... together with several other impatient passengers we kept on inquiring but were getting no response on the flight for hyd.

Finally we were told that the flight will leave at about 11 pm ...11 pm past still noting ,,,,,, finally the flight arrived and got scheduled at 00.15 hours for hyd. Already impressed with the service standards of AI, i asked the AI ground staff to confirm if my bags have been loaded in this aircraft..... to which the staff checked and assured me that your bags are already loaded. happy that finally the ordeal is over, we boarded the flight which might have flown out of mumbai around 1 am.

We reached Hyd at 2 am and after scouting from belts to belts we finally realised that our bags are missing. ...at about 2.30 we approached the baggage section and they checked into the systems and said our bags were not loaded by mumbai and will arrive in the morning flight and will be delivered to your address.

That was it, perhaps the only time when i must have lost my cool in the whole day. .... but it was of no use as the AI staff like any government servant have no sense of job responsibility neitto w morning you should call after 9.30 am .. (gave me a number to call at) and the person will tell you about the status. .... exhausted, helpless, disappointed and disparaged, with long faces we left the airport at 3.15 am for the 5 star hotel we booked and wasted the days booking money.

Upon reaching the hotel i realised about my morning conference and how on earth was it possible to get business cloths by 9 am in morning to make it to the conference which again was other side of the town from where we were staying. Left with no option i wrote an email to the conference organizers notifying them with a last minute withdrawal and with all my apologies for the inconvenience ... yes a common man has the courtesy and courage to apologize, unlike these government servants.

we checked into our room at 4.30 am and slept thinking how difficult the day was on us ... and how shattered our plans were by the end of the day. Apart from the inconvenience caused to my family ... we couldnt make it to the family function, i had to skip my conference meeting, we wasted the money on hotel booking and are sleeping here with no luggage. ..... what a day.

When someone would say .. now what wrong can happen ... the AI has few more to offer ... [ i dont know about anyone who is reading this, but i myself am getting tired writing about it any further, so would cut the further ordeal in short]

after atleast 50 calls (including few people who stopped picking my phone and had to request hotel team to call on my behalf) and hearing to 5 different stories (obviously with false information) i could finally reach to one Mr. Sharat (040 66603056) at 4.30 pm in the evening and he told me all the people whom you have spoken so far have given you false stories about our baggages ... your bags have now left mumbai and will arrive here at hyd at 6 pm. I will personally make sure that the bags are cleared out on priority and we shall send them to you by today itself thru our logstics partner Mr. Joshi / Mr Sainath He also gave me Mr. Joshi's/Sainath's number. Who confirmed to me of my bags at 7.30 and finally delivered them to my hotel at 10 pm in the night.,........ in the afternoon, when i had demanded for some compensation to buy new cloths (i was told that the other airlines has this policy) the baggage section people refused saying we dont have any policy for such payments and at max we can go out and shop what you need, Send us the bills, we will examine and let you know, the maximum amount we can pay is Rs 500.

I complained at various forums and am yet to receive any feedback

column6: The Never Ending Terror Of Air India
column7:
I would like to start off by telling all readers what a disgrace Air India is to India, Indians and its passengers. I would like to share a recent experience that I had with Air India during my travel to India.

The nightmare started on Tuesday, April 18. I had come to India because of a sudden death in my family and I was scheduled to return to the US on April 18. My return flight was scheduled from Ahmedabad to Delhi and then Delhi to JFK, New York. Please note that this flight was full and consisted of about 300 passengers, majority of whom were elderly people (on wheel chairs) as well as numerous children.

The level of incompetence showed by Air India during this flight is unimaginable. It is even more difficult to digest the fact that these people who are working for Air India represent India and Indians worldwide. What a shame! What a disgrace! Not just for the Air India team but the Indian government in general. Given that this is a “government” airline these fools thinks they can get paid without doing any work!

The following events took place at the Delhi Airport on between Tuesday, April 18 and Wednesday, April 19:

1: 30 AM (Inside Air India Flight) - All passengers were boarded on to the flight as the flight was supposed to take off at 1:45 AM.

2:00 AM (Inside Air India Flight) – The AC inside the flight was switched off. Current temperature in Delhi: 100 °C +.

2:15 AM (Inside Air India Flight) - One of the captains announced that they were experiencing some delays due to “technical difficulties” and that we are expected to take off in 12 - 15 minutes.

2:30 AM (Inside Air India Flight) – Passengers are walking around the cabin, picking up magazines to use as a fan. Kids are screaming because of the heat, exhaustion and lack of sleep.

Between 2:30 – 3:00 PM (Inside Air India Flight) – One of the crew members announces that all passengers are going to have to get off the plane.

All passengers stood up, got their carry on’s and waited patiently for the door to open. 10 minutes later, the same crew member announces “All passengers please get back to your assigned seats” and no other information…

3:30 AM (Inside Air India Flight) - Once hour later the flight stood exactly where it was without any announcements or information from the crew members regarding the further delay. When I decided to approach one of the crew members asking what the problem was, their response “ We don’t know maam so we don’t know what to tell you”.

Between 3:30 – 4:00 PM (Inside Air India Flight) – Once again, one of the crew member announces that all passengers are going to have to get off the plane. All passengers stood up, got their carry on’s and waited patiently for the doors to open. Within a few minutes , the same crew member announces “All passengers please get back to your assigned seats” and ONCE AGAIN providing NO other information…

4:00 AM (Inside Air India Flight) - Two and half hours into this nightmare as the heat became unbearable some of the passengers requested that Air India let people back into the terminal while they waited. One of the people requesting this was a mother carrying her child who was suffering with fever while another passenger was a diabetic patient. Air India refused this request and after some heated arguments with passengers they finally opened the airline door so the passengers could wait in the aerobridge area that connects the flight and terminal. See pictures.

5:00 AM (Inside Air India Flight) - FINALLY! They decided they were going to let people on to the terminal. Their reasoning for this – We are going to fly another plane to JFK so all passengers will have to change flights.

6:00 AM (Inside Terminal) – After almost five hours’ worth of wait, someone from Air India at the Delhi Airport tells a handful of passengers that this flight is being CANCELLED. After being asked by several people to SPEAK UP and INFORM ALL PASSENGERS OF THE CHANGE this man finally made an announcement.

Reasoning for cancellation – the crew’s shift is over and they have left so there is no one who can fly the plane (Are you serious?). The next flight will depart to JFK today evening at 5PM AND in the meantime all passengers are being taken to a hotel WHICH IS ONE HOUR AWAY FROM THE AIRPORT (Again, Are you SERIOUS?!?). All passengers will need to COLLECT THEIR LUGGAGE and CANCEL THEIR IMMIGRATION to they can take the evening flight.

6:30 AM (Delhi Airport) – I have decided I am not going to a random hotel. Given the lack of disorganization that Air India has shown tonight I do not trust that the evening flight will depart. I decided to purchase an Emirates ticket for a flight to JFK which was departing at 11:00 AM instead.

After cancelling my immigration I asked an Air India representative what the process was if I wanted to get back bags back. She asked me to go upstairs to the second floor to the Air India counter and ask them for my bags.

When I reached the Air India counter on the second floor, the man at the counter said he cannot help me and that I need to go to the baggage check in counter for Air India and they will provide my bags. So I go there. The female staff at this counter tells me “I don’t know anything about this flight”. Then I ask a third person and explain my situation that the flight was cancelled and I have another flight at 11:00 AM, whose check in will close at 10:00 AM so I need my bags. This man finally tells me that he can get my bags but it’s going to take them 4 HOURS. By now it is 7:00 AM and my check in with emirates was going to close at 10:00 AM leaving me 3 hours to get my bags back.

Given my lack of time, the male staff I was speaking with calls a female staff to assist. Once again, she gives me the same excuses that the other person did. By this point, I have had no sleep, no food and no rest. I tell her “I don’t care that the process says you need 4 hours, I only have 3 hours and I don’t want to miss my next flight so PLEASE atleast TRY to get my bags”. At this she says “Maam if you don’t care then I can’t help you” and WALKS AWAY!

ARE YOU SERIOUS? Where do these people get SO much ego from? Aren’t we as Indians supposed to be kind hearted? Aren’t we supposed to help each other in need? What do these staff members get paid for? Why do they even get a salary? And why are they not fired already? Oh! That’s right – it's a government agency where it is almost impossible to fire people. So here we are, stuck having to deal with absolute IDIOTS!

Finally, after repeatedly pleading to the other staff member one of the on floor managers came to me. He said they would try his best to get my bags and takes my passport. Given how frustrated I was by this point I didn’t think twice before giving him my passport. BIG MISTAKE – DO NOT GIVE YOUR PASSPORT TO ANY AIR INDIA STAFF MEMBERS!

This floor manager gives my passport to one of his workers and sends him to retrieve my bags.

8:30 AM (Air India Counter) – Can you check to see if they founds my bags? Their reply – yes, he is completing paperwork and will be back in an hour.

9:00 AM (Air India Counter) – Can you check to see if they are on their way? Their reply – yes, he is on the way.

9:30 AM (Air India Counter) – Can you check to see if he is almost here, my check in closes in 30 minutes? Their reply – yes, he is almost here.

9:45 AM (Next flight check in closing at 10:00 AM) – The floor manager calls the guy who is out retrieving my bags. The on floor manager tells me “Looks like they have the wrong bags”….

This was the moment I lost all faith, in this Airline, their staff and the Indian Government! I think at this point it is ok to say that it’s not the individual agencies who are 100% incompetent. It is the Indian Government who is incompetent.

9:55 AM (Air India Counter) - NOW, the on floor manager tells me – why don’t you take the emirates flight, we will send your luggage on the next Air India flight to JFK. Again, ARE YOU KIDDING ME? If this was an option, why did you not let me do this when I had initially asked if my bags could be delivered directly to JFK? Oh my goodness, I mean the level of STUPIDITY Air India!

10:00 AM (Emirates Counter) – Emirates was ready to close their check in counter. I pleaded and they agreed that they would wait 10 more minutes for me. By now you must be wondering – well the guy fetched the wrong bags so what were you still waiting for?

Well, MY PASSPORT!

While I am pleading emirates to keep their counter open, the Air India guy is on his phone saying that we cannot find the guy that has your passport…

Readers: Do you feel the anxiety? And the frustration? And the Anger by now?

10:15 AM (Emirates Counter) – The Air India Idiot who had my passport finally arrived and Emirates was kind enough to let me board the flight!!

For those who watch hindi movies – you know how in patriotic movies when they show a long time Indian prisoner being released from Pakistan gets to come home to India he drops to the ground with happiness. That was how I felt when my flight landed in JFK…

P.S: After returning home, Air India called 4 days later telling me that my bags would be delivered at night between 11:30 PM and 1:30 AM on a work night. When we called to ask for a refund, they told us to follow up with the Ahmedabad office!!! The nightmare just DOESN’T END!!!

For all readers / travelers considering Air India: Please, please, please, unless you have no other options please travel by a better airline instead of using Air India. My husband and I had no choice when we booked our flights, we booked the first flight to India upon receiving news of a death in our family.

column7: Air India was unbelievably inept and uncaring. The flight had to make an emergency landing in Ankara to evacuate an ill passenger. Nobody had problems with that. It was the right thing to do. However we ended up staying Ankara for 24 hours and received NO updates or information from Air India. We were herded like cattle into a narrow and cold departure lounge, guarded by airport security. Most of us were dressed for the heat of Mumbai, not the chill of an Ankara winter night. We were not allowed to leave this area, even those of us who did not need visas for Turkey. The Air India staff disappeared completely (taken to hotels) while we passengers were treated like sub-humans. column6: First time Traveling to Europe with Maharaja
column7:
In spite of being a very frequent overseas traveler, I have never tried Air India and always opted for Emirates , Etihad or Lufthansa. During my current trip to Germany on 22nd Apr'17, I opted for Air India little reluctantly and out of compulsion. The first leg of the travel was with flight AI 21 from Kolkata to Delhi. Check in was smooth and fast luggage was booked directly to Frankfurt. Immigration was also done at Kolkata, which is always a better option than at Delhi. Post immigration , I was invited to the Travel Club Lounge for a quick breakfast. I selected seat 2B an aisle seat. Seat configuratuon was 2 2 2 . It was quiet spacious in the cabin with only 18 seats. Flight departed on time. It was a B 787 Dreamliner aircraft. The aircraft surprisingly looked worn out considering the fact that B 787 is a new aircraft. Welcome drink Virgin Mojito was very refreshing. Sandwiches and light brunch was served. Presentation of food was below par for Business Class. Coffee was served in crockery but instead of cutlery, cheap disposable plastic spoon was given. These small things make a lot of difference. Flight landed after 15 minute delay and I had to rush to Gate 13 which was quiet far. There was chaotic crowd at the transfer security check thanks to Delhi Airport. I manged to board my connecting flight 131 just on time. This was also a 787 Dreamliner. Flight was full. I had seat 1D an aisle seat of my choice. Interior of the aircraft is below par as compared to its Indian Peer Airlines or other European or Middle East Airlines. Seats was full flat but not to my expectation as a frequent business passenger. There was extreme lack of privacy in the seat alignment. Absolutely no plan to create storage of small acessories. Menu card was given. But no separate wine list in Business Class. So shocking. Flight took off on time. Non alcoholic welcome drink was offered. I went for coconut water. Flight entertaient system offered choice of Indian and western movies. Toilet in Business Class also looked sub standard to me. Lunch was served after take off. There was good choice in main course, I opted for Prawn Newburg served with persley potatoes and vegetables. Wine selection was very substandard. I asked for white wine with my prawns but they had ordinary Chaddonney and Bourdeaux. Quality was not upto the mark. I had to ask for comfort kit which was supposed to be given normally. While sleeping good duvet was made available. Before landing light snacks of kebabs and sandwiches was served. I ended my food with a glass of cognac. Flight landed on time and luggage was at the carousel before I reached there.
To sum up my experience , first with negatives : 1. Aircraft had pretty ordinary interior with compromised passenger comfort. Looks to be the cheapest within 787 class 2. Lack of privacy in the seat. They should have provided retractable privacy curtain 3. Food is not up to business class standard, presentation very poor 4. Worst choice of wine and alcoholic beverages 5. Toilet is very ordinary 6. No in-flight duty free shopping. 6. You do not feel of class and real business class flavor.
Now with positives : 1. Latest N787 Dreamliner aircraft 2. Good connectivity 3. Lands at T1 which is close to train station 4. Cheaper than its competitors by at least 10-15% 5. Through Check in and immigration at Kolkata.
My conclusion : Do take if you get at good bargain. You have to compromise real business class feel that you get in Emirates or Lufthansa or other middle east or European airlines.

column7:
We had booked our flight with Air India from Goa to Mumbai departing on flight AI84, Wednesday 1st March at 22.35. We were then connecting with Air India flight to Bangkok which was departing on 2nd March at 01.45.

We were able to check in online the day before, so all was good and we arranged for the taxi to pick us up at 20.30 to take us to the airport, so everything was ready. We were going to enjoy our last day on the beach and have an early dinner there before setting off.

About 10 o'clock, morning of the 1st, we got an email and a phone call from Air India informing us that the Goa to Mumbai flight was delayed by 1 hour and we would be departing at 23.30. They also advised that we might not make the Bangkok connecting flight. There is only 1 Air India flight a day to Bangkok.

We phoned Air India back, 45 minute call, trying to change our flight to an earlier departure from Goa. We got seats on flight AI 662, leaving Goa at 18.45, but we had to be at the Airport by 16.30 to claim the tickets, or we would loose them. This meant hanging around Dabolim airport for 2 hours. It was important that we made the connecting onward flight as we had booked a taxi and paid for a taxi to collect us and we had paid for the hotel.

The boarding went smoothly as the plane pushed back 10 minutes early and was in the air on time. But due to congestion at Mumbai we were slightly late landing there.

The seats were ok, suitable for a short haul flight and leg room reasonable, the cabin crew did not appear very interested.

We were served a snack, which was awful, it consisted of 2 slices of dry bread with a slice of sweaty cheese inside and a small bottle of water.

Once in Mumbai airport we had to hang around for 5 hours, not in our original plan, Air India did not offer us use of a longe or anything for the inconvenience and disruption, in fact they did not even apologise.

Overall opinion of Air India, not a lot. We also think that the original flight was cancelled as it never appeared on the flight information board in Mumbai.

column6: March 9, Delhi to SFO Direct Service, devoid of "Service" !
column7:
AI 173, March 9 DEL-SFO

WOW! Where do I start as to how the flight was:

Let me begin with the good part - It is a direct flight - very convenient; and it was mostly on time - both departure and arrival . But that is where the good part ends in my experience.

a) The cabin becomes a dust bin littered with stuff within first couple of hours. You can only imagine the toilet facilities - if they can be called facilities. The crew apperas oblivious to it - they do nothing about it where I have seen other airline crew making sure isles and even toilets are clean during the flight. Perhaps AI should fine people for littering inside the plane! They will make enough money to become profitable!

b) Flight attendant service was non existent. My isle was served by this one exceptional person - exceptionally RUDE on so many dimensions that is - Makrant Desai - condescending - like when I asked for help to bring down my bag from the overhead bin (way too high for me to reach) when I needed to take out a medicine he told me repeatedly I should keep it under my seat. I can only surmise, so I would not bother him again. This person exhibited total lack of understanding of his job that is rooted in “serving” his customers.

c) I was a bit sick on this flight so I didn’t eat any of the meals they served. You’d expect the crew to try to help make the passenger comfortable, just a bit - but they had nothing to offer! Also between meals during snack service, they put out a big trash bag in the food area which got filled quickly with discarded stuff, and parents were having tough time keeping their small children out of that. They really should not be doing that - its a a safety issue. Trash bin should be something children can't get into easily.

It is rather unfortunate the airline PM Modi so proudly stated would bring direct service to travelers between SFO and the Indian Capital is so devoid of “service”. Their crew does not really extend one morsel of care - and for the long flight that it, their food service seems like a “fast food service”. Crew dishes out instructions - get in your seats, open your tray tables .. so that they have to spend no time putting your tray on it and move on asap.

The fact that you can get non-stop from point A to point B has its merits but I for one value some degree of service and care if I am going to be on it for 15 long hours. So I only hope that I never have to get on this one again.

For some reason, I am a firm believer in Air India and will continue to use them for rather parochial reasons, but I feel, with a little bit of effort , they can save money and make customers happy.

I must say that I have a bit of a bias for Air India . I have been subjected to Jet Airways, KLM, Lufthansa, Virgin, Gulf, Emirates, SAs (when they used to fly to India),
I love SAS but they dont fly from Copenhagen to Delhi anymore, rather unfortunate.

I seriously want Air India to be the best carrier for India !!!

Overall, this was probably the best ever Air India flight I have taken. What a shame all the airline's plane interiors aren't like this one.

My feelings and I flew with Air India to Delhi, we booked these flights as they were affordable, direct, and to be honest we didn't review beforehand!

The flight and airline itself was fine - a bit chaotic (mainly the other passengers creating chaos)... at times it was even comical!

We seemed to be the only passengers able to locate our allocated seat without confusion, which was odd, as each ticket provides a seat number - understanding culture differences we though perhaps this is due to the numbers.

During the flight we were comfortable, had a selection of in house entertainment with some good films! The screens are dated and quite unresponsive and slow! If you accidentally stop a film halfway through good luck getting back to the same point!

Halfway through the flight a lady tried to climb over me, I was a bit confused, it turns out she wanted to get to the seat next to me - I couldn't work out why she didn't ask, or get my attention first, she then continued to lean on me and cough in my ear for the remaining 6 hours of the flight, and use my USB port etc.. (they provide USB!).. that's a plus!

The staff were ok, but didn't really see the need to see to the western girls (us) needs / requests, we usually had to ask about 3 or 4 times... there was no logical order to serving the customers, it seemed favourable.

The toilets could have been cleaner, however did provide mouthwash (random)...

The food was good - we both enjoyed Indian breakfast and lunch, it was tasty and filling. The snacks were Minimal, and water was sparing - we both felt pretty dehydrated!

All in all, we paid £298 for a direct flight from London to Delhi, we weren't expecting luxury, but I would suggest to expect 'random'!

Happy flying!

Understaffed, unorganized and inefficient airport staff:

Bad & Ugly:
My wife and I took this flight out of compulsion due to a bereavement in the family.
To start we could not select seats together on the AI website or APP. Both were extremely complicated and absolutely not user friendly.
On getting to the airport we were told the flight was full but when we got on board six seats had been blocked for the crew (Do they not have bunks?) Finally we were able to sit together.
Interior of the aircraft looked as if it had never been cleaned and parts of the seat were broken, the buttons to adjust the seat were not legible and were extremely grimy.
The seating arrangement was 2 - 3 - 2 very strange.
Meal service was a joke, no printed menus choice of food pathetic, service and presentation a joke. See photographs.
Choice of wine was white or red - laughable, they were serving the cheapest wine on the market.
We could barely eat the food provided as it looked stale and unappetizing.
After the meal service we asked for a bottle of water and it took three requests before we received it.
Seats - advertised as full flat beds but not nearly flat they seats has a very weird incline and not cushion, you could feel the metal frame through the padding. Very uncomfortable
On waking up around three hours before landing we were served tea in the tiniest cups.
We kept waiting for breakfast service but no one came around, around 45 minuted before landing we were told since we were sleeping they did not wake us, but we were served tea a few hours ago?
On landing at Delhi we tried to use the AI lounge at the domestic airport, I explained to the person at the desk that we had flown DEL-NY and had to fly back right away NY-DEL and would like to use the lounge, but to no vail.

All I can say is even if I was offered a free ride on AI I would not take it, the government of India should be embarrassed to offer a product that is so horrible.

Look at the pictures.

Last November my daughter & I had just enjoyed holiday in India during the Diwali Festival - fantastic
The pollution & smoke from fireworks during the festival gives many people respiratory problems. Many people on the Air India flight were coughing which was to be expected, - but two women behind (our friend was sitting next to them) were coughing & then spitting onto the floor. Surely this is not acceptable.

On arrival, our luggage was damaged mine a soft cover was bent/twisted but not torn. My daughter's expensive Samsonite hard cases were ruined.. Both cases had multiple cracks right through the shell & handle, they cannot be used any longer. My daughter reported the broken cases immediately, forms filled & photos taken and the all important ref number & contact phone number for her to call.
She tried the contact number many times during our stay in Sri Lanka & got the run around. She was told to meet an Air India employee at Colombo airport before departure. This caused problems as we needed to check in & the Air India representative had to be called many times, he eventually turned up with two other men. They really didn't care when they looked at the damage cases and were certainly not going to take responsibility for the damage. Then an offer of $75 for the damage. A very uncomfortable discussion went on - No, their boss Lady could not come she was in her city office (we had 2 hours till the plane departed) - They withdrew their $75 offer & told us to go to the Air India office in our home city of Perth. Where is the office? we asked - They came back & said there was no Perth office - we should go to the Sydney or Melbourne office. - "Do you know how faraway we live from Sydney?"
Clearly these employees were not the people that we should have had to deal with. They appeared to have no managerial or customer service skills. My personal feeling is because we were women, these AI employees had no intension of doing anything & were stalling. Knowing that no further face to face discussion could take place after we left the country, and the report would never be followed up. Since returning home my daughter has phoned the Air India office in Colombo - you guessed it no result.
Air India will not suffer because of my review - as they have so many people traveling between Delhi & Colombo.
Surely someone at Air India must be responsible for customer care & service.

column6: Outstanding service from a truly caring airline

Having previous good experience of travelling to the US by Air India on several occasions, I was happy to use them for a social trip to Punjab, India. What I did not realise at the time of selection was the extent to which we would be forced to lean on their 'good offices'.

My wife had the misfortune to succumb to a stomach bug during the latter part of our trip and was feeling unwell as we started our return flight from Amritsar. By the time we reached Delhi, for an en-route top, she was clearly becoming seriously ill and after landing I requested the attendance of a doctor on the aircraft. The doctor asked that she be removed for the flight and my wide received excellent attention in the airport medical centre. Unfortunately her recovery caused us to miss re-embarkation of the aircraft by a few minutes.

The ground staff at Delhi obtained permission for our (non-transferable) tickets to be re-validated for the following day at no charge and then arranged for us to stay overnight at the on-site hotel, again at no charge to us. This being such a short flight a snack was served. No choice was given so everyone had a coleslaw sandwich with a mango fruit juice and a water. I can't say I'm enamoured by coleslaw sandwiches, even with adding the supplied ketchup. Needless to say I gave it a miss and just took the water. I noticed most people around me didn't have the juice - a small chocolate like a KitKat would be more welcoming I'm sure.

Staff were pleasant on this flight and had to be well organised given the brevity of it.

Would use Air India again, but it's not my preferred Indian airline.

column1: Joan N wrote a review Jan 2017
column6: Very helpful when luggage was delayed
column7: One of our checked luggage items was held at the Mumbai airport, and the Air India staff worked hard to figure out what happened. Once they located the bag, they notified both us & our hotel in order to reach us. The bag was delivered the next day. Very pleasantly surprised with the level of service & of course very happy that we were able to get the bag.

We hadn't even entered the airport when we were told the once-a-day flight had been cancelled. Air India staff could not have been LESS helpful. First, they wouldn't let us up to the counter because we didn't have tickets.

YES, you read that correctly.

They would not entertain the notion that they should reroute us through Delhi or elsewhere. Every question we had was answered with "it's no problem." Well, clearly it was.

After being shuffled about for two hours, they put us on a bus back to Varanasi and put us in a shady hotel, one that had no idea we were arriving. A terrible experience that cut our time in Nepal by a full day.

Once we were flying, it was clear that the plane and its staff were not as good as the discount carriers like Kingfisher and Jet, which we had already flown.

The plane even looked like it needed to be washed on the outside!

Then an elderly gentleman thought he heard a child crying in the toilet so alerted cabin crew. A staff member then opened the toilet lock without knocking first and discovered a male passenger inside who was annoyed he'd been barged in on so the flight attendant then stood there shouting at the elderly gentleman saying it's his fault she opened the door because he misinformed her! Both gentlemen looked embarrassed as she caused a scene. When I got up to ask for a drink cabin crew rolled their eyes at me as though it was a huge inconvenience even though they hadn't offered drinks for several hours. The aircraft was dirty and the carpet threadbare. The whole experience was absolutely awful and considering I've flown approximately 70 times with various airlines I would NEVER fly with Air India again. The entire crew from ground staff to cabin crew need to learn some manners and respect and certainly need to be trained in customer service.

The Aircrafts are old , the seats worn and tatty. The entertainment system does not work well. On one leg of the flight, I knew several members of our group whose entertainment systems did not work. When the crew member was notified,his only response was to agree that it is not working. He did not offer to help in any way.

The Crew: the worst customer service I have ever experienced on a flight. I couldn't understand this because India prides itself on amazing hospitality. Indeed, I have experienced this first hand whenever I stay at Indian hotels. I have used other Airlines serviced by Indian staff like Jet Airways and Etihad, and the experience on those occasions were great. The Food: I am not a great fan of flight food but on one occasion they served a croissant with cheese that looked like it had been put together by a 3 year old.

Overall, one of those experiences I would never ever want to repeat even if they are the last airline left in the world!! India can definitely do a lot better than this

Only a couple of positives in my review. The aircraft (Dreamliner) was very comfortable. It was clean and most importantly, the seats had more leg room than some of the more illustrious airlines flying Mumbai - Singapore route, including Singapore airlines. AI's Dreamliner had the best economy class seats I have seen in recent times. Secondly, the flight departed bang on time. (May be I was fortunate!).

Now coming to service, Air India has a long way to go before being compared with the good airlines in the world. A long long way to go, I would say. Here's why -

1. Check in at Mumbai airport took a good 1 hour. They had just 1 check in row to cover all international flights departing from Mumbai (including a couple of counters for business class). Non separate counters for baggage drop for those who have pre selected their seats. On inquiry with the staff, I understand that it is very normal to have such long queues at their check in counters. This is definitely not acceptable!

2. The cabin crew obviously does not believe in 'service with smile' policy. A passenger seated besides me passed his coat to a cabin crew member to store in the rack during the flight. He was sternly told by the cabin crew member that he should 'remind' them (to return the coat) after the plane lands. The good airlines in the industry do not expect to be 'reminded' to do their duty! .... and when the passenger did remind the cabin crew members a few minutes before landing, he was told "why don't you collect it after the plane lands".... The cabin crew member has no business to pose a counter question to a passenger. If he has difficulty in returning the coat at that time, he should just say that he is unable to return the coat now because of ___.

3. On all other overnight flights from Mumbai to Singapore, I have seen cabin crew move around with trays containing water/fruit juice. Lot of passengers do like to have a glass of water or juice after a couple of hours of sleep just prior to landing. Air India seems to have a 'water on demand' policy. If you want water, you have to call the cabin crew member. The lucky ones are served, or else, the cabin crew members conveniently ignore the requests.

AI's cabin crew service had always been their weak point. I travelled AI after a long gap and found that (sadly), their service still needs miles of improvement.

column7:
I traveled on the Air India flight as part of my International trip from Surat, India to Denver via New Delhi, JFK, New York. I traveled by Air India upto JFK, NY and from there was booked on Delta on a single PNR.

The in-flight experience in AI from Surat to Delhi on AI 490 and it was fine - this being an evening flight it was an Airbus 320 - a large aircraft that could accommodate my luggage. The same in the flight from Delhi to JFK, NY i.e. AI 101 was also good - it was a sort of "overnight" journey - board at around 1:00 am and land at 07:00 am local times.

The following could be useful to those aiming for similar travel:
1. When I checked in at Surat India, my two suitcases were thorough checked-in upto JFK, NY. The luggage check-in upto Denver was not possible, even though had a single PNR. I must acknowledge that the airline officials at Surat were very cooperative and they tried all their means to see that the luggage is thorough checked-in - however that was not possible.
2. However, at JFK, NY, after I finished immigration and customs immediately outside there was a counter of Delta through which I could checkin my luggage again. So even though my outbound flight from JFK, NY to Denver was from a different terminal, I did not have to actually carry the luggage with me, Simply drop the luggage at the Delta counter and then proceed to the terminal to collect the boarding pass. This was a great relief, though thorough check-in of the luggage upto Denver would have been great.
3. One of the strange aspect for the flight 101 originating from Delhi is that, one has to do security check TWICE - first the routine security check at the airport and then one more AT THE GATE. This is the first time ever, I experienced such dual security checks. So one muse be prepared for the unnecessary hassles !!

Thanks.

column1: Rakesh A wrote a review Nov 2016
column7:
I had to fly back from Bangkok to Amritsar via New Delhi. The flight was delayed for technical reasons, initially only for 30 minutes or so. But eventually we were into the flight after more than 5 hours. Apparently this was done to avoid giving an accomodation.
Then, when we got into the aircraft, the aircon was not working and it was boiling hot. After insisting by the passengers, the passengers were deplaned.
Then we were told that we would be given accomodation in some hotel. At the last moment, we were informed that flight was ready to take off in another 2 hours. It was 3:00 pm at that time. So we had a choice that we could fly on the same day or we could wait for the next day. We were told that the technical issue has been fixed.
However, we were boarded the next time only after 4 hours at around 7:00 pm and in the plane, aircon was still not working. For the whole duration, we had to use the safety instructions card to fan our faces.
When we got down at Delhi, we were told that we had to take our baggages and check them in again for the next flight and we were taken to Hotel Taurus. The condition of the hotel was terrible.
Then when we finally reached Amritsar at 6:00 am in the morning, we did not get our baggage. It could have been understandable if they had to transfer the baggage to the new flight. But this happened even after we collected the baggage on our own and checked it in again at the next counter.
Then we were handed over a Property Irregularity Report at the airport. The person said that the baggages would reach our address on the same day and gave us two contact numbers. Its been two days now, no baggage delivery yet, no communication from their side and even after calling on these numbers, no one is picking the phone up. I must have tried the numbers atleast 20 times.
I think its highly unprofessional of Air India. The staff and management are bringing huge shame to the nation.

Check-in was quick and efficient. Security checks completed OK. Departure Area offered more comfort. Departure was delayed due to late arrival. Food fine. Uneventful but crowded flight. column6: GLIDE ABOVE THE CLOUDS IN SHEER LUXURY
column7:
Feel like sharing my great experience with the Air India recently. I always felt that our national carrier is not getting its due share of appreciation. Air India has certainly changed for the better.
I took AI 307 from Narita, Japan to Delhi on the 22nd October. The Japanese staffs who were handling the check-in counter were very courteous and eager to help the passengers. In a crowded air line check-in counter there are always passengers who lose their patience. The check-in counter of AI 307 was not different. The staff, however, was very polite and attended to all passengers with their inherent politeness. Air India apparently does not have its own lounge in Narita and AI passengers are handled by Air China. The lounge overlooking the runway is well furnished. It had a fairly good stock of food and beverages.
The best part was the service on board and the flight in itself. The crew on board Ms Achla, Ms Shagufta and Ms Saito were extremely courteous and equally efficient at the same time maintaining true professionalism. Every need of the passengers were anticipated and met very promptly. The starters, the main course of lunch and the snacks in the afternoon were all delicious and presented matching to or even surpassing the dishes of any premium restaurant. The flight, a Boeing 787, very aptly called the dream liner, was very smooth, gliding above the clouds, all through the little over eight hours it took to reach Delhi from Narita. Since the air pressure in the air craft was maintained at 6000 feet compared to 8000 feet in other aircrafts there was more oxygen and higher moisture in the cabin, making one feel very fresh even after such a long haul flight. I could get a good two hour sleep in flight on the seat which reclined to a flat bed.
Anyone with this experience will never be contented with anything less. The AI hospitality indeed had a touch class. Felt really proud to be an Indian. I am very happy to recommend this flight to all discerning travelers.
The flight took-off on time and landed Delhi 20 Min before it's scheduled arrival time. A comfortable seat with a bigger leg room, I liked the hot and tasty food served in the aircraft.

I think we are quick in judging the moment we hear Air India but I was pleasantly surprised and happy to experience what i did.

We traveled in Economy class and surprisingly the leg room was much better compared to some of the other economy class. Flying in the new 787 dreamliner was a great experience.

the service was awesome and the food was great(being Indian helped i guess) the flight crew was serving the passengers with all they could and very accommodating and helpful.

The flight takes nearly 13 hours but it was not as tiring since the legroom is good.

Also since it takes you direct to Delhi you save a lot of time compared to flying into Singapore, Hong Kong etc.

column7:
Having flown with Air India before and having a bad experience I didn't think that the second time would be as bad, how very wrong could I be. This journey was the compensation I received as Air India misplaced by luggage the first time I traveled with them, which I did not get it back for 4 days.
This trip was booked over 6 months prior to us travelling and the seats reserved.
We booked in at Birmingham airport at 19:30 for our flight at 21:00 which went without a hitch. The check in agent booked us through on all three legs of our trip which was via New Delhi and Mumbai. The first leg of our journey took us to New Delhi arriving at 10:30 local time the next day which was fine, just as it should be. We transferred through IGI in Delhi without a hitch and caught our flight to Mumbai. We went to check in for our last leg to Goa I was held me back while the rest of our party and everyone else boarded as there was a problem with my booking (remember I had been checked through in Birmingham the previous evening). The surly check in clerk made a phone call and came back with my ticket with my seat reservation crossed out and a new seat handwritten on it. The flight was late boarding so this hold up made it even later. When I got on the plane I found someone else sitting in my seat. I told the cabin attendant there was someone sat in my seat, but she wasn't interested either and said I would have to sit somewhere else separate from the rest of the group. I asked how could my seat be reallocated after it had been booked 6 months prior and confirmed the previous evening at the start of our trip, guess what "not interested" This alteration that Air India caused now meant that the flight missed it's slot and was late taking off. When we arrived at Goa airport we went to collect our luggage and I noticed the Air India ground staff waiting to deal with passengers complaints with their missing luggage forms in hand. Not once did I think that my luggage would go missing a second time, how wrong could I be. All the other luggage for our group arrived, except mine. The staff at Goa airport could not have been anymore unhelpful if they tried. Nobody was the least bit interested as this happens all the time, and did not seem bothered that I was without any of my belongings. I spoke to 3 different people and each was as uninterested as the last, even the station manager. I was offered IR1500 as a payment for the inconvenience which I was told to collect on the way back through the airport on my return journey. I eventually got this up to IR2000 as when this happened to me 2 years previously this is what I received. If I hadn't argued I guess that someone would have kept this for themselves.
If you are considering using Air India I would seriously look at using different airline as Air India's service is very poor, and there are far better airlines out there to choose from.

column6: Birmingham-Mumbai sector needs a Direct flight atleast weekly once
column7:
There is no direct flight from Birmingham to Mumbai.So many passengers at Birmingham airport are confused whether luggage will have to be collected at Delhi airport or not. The details provided telephonically by Air India representatives are misleading at times saying luggage needs to be collected directly in Mumbai, which in not the case

One has to collect the luggage at Delhi and that being your first port of entry, you have to go through immigration and security check. The Delhi airport staff is not upto the mark as yet. Its quite a big airport and you have literally run from your international terminal to your domestic one. With a child it becomes really very cumbersome. Some of our friends forgot to check-in the liquor at Delhi Domestic terminal which they had earlier collected at Birmingham airport. Please ensure to check in the liquor bottles.

Also the security check in at Delhi takes ages. The tray to put your electronic items is very small. It was very frustrating to go through the hassle of changing from international to domestic terminal especially after a long flight journey when you are extremely tired.
It was a good experience to travel in this flight. They are very considerate and try to ensure that you travel comfortably. Generally the flight is on time.

column1: Carlton W wrote a review Oct 2016
column6: Looked after me better than the British Embassy
column7:
I duely booked my flights online to come back to the UK after almost 2 years away and ended up flying with Air India. My First Flight from BKK was on a new Dreamliner plane which was great, food excellent, staff very pleasant and entertainment options great - all was just perfect on the first stretch of my travel home. There was a transfer as part of my travel, so I had to change at New Dehli for a connecting flight to London - This is where the nightmare started - once getting off one plane you were then guided to yet another security area where your luggage and person were again checked by security, the International Transfers lounge was absolutely heaving and in front of me I could just see what looked like a never-ending mass of thousands of people, at this point I was a little worried that I would not get my connecting flight which was just over one hour away.

After at least 30/40 minutes of queuing up - I could finally see the security check area. It was amass with people all trying to get through what seemed like a very very lackadaisical approach to security, the Airport staff were joking about and being very very slow in their approach to security, it was disorganised and massively understaffed - everyone was very agitated - to be honest, the security area was diabolical and people started to jostle each other about at flight times were getting very close to the knuckle. I finally get to put my bag through the x-ray machine and have a body search, it was at this 'even more chaotic' part of the security area that I had my passport stolen - yes stolen in security!!! This meant I would miss my flight. The 'big boss' came to see me and i can only assume his team were watching CCTV to identify the person that took my passport - I was beside myself.
After 4 hours or so, i was paraded BACK to the International Transfers lounge - where i had been 5 hours ago and left - with the explanation that 'we will be with you in a moment sir'. Imagine - my phone only worked in Thailand, there are no food concessions, no shops, no ATMs, no internet - a lounge with just a frantic Air India team all working behind a large desk - I was in 'no man's land' and after another hour or so I was met by an Air India Official who explained that the forms that had been given to me by the head of the airport security dept to travel would not be sufficient as I am unable to fly without a passport, he was very kind and gave me some time to just explain my situation - which i would continue to do at least 15 more times to different officials. He beckoned me over to speak to the British Embassy in India, who were absolutely terrible, no help, no visit, no food - NOTHING, so I'm stuck, by now it was evening and i had been there since about 10am - I was offered food by Air India. to be honest, it wasn't anything to do with Air India, it was due to the erratic complete disorganization of the airport security department, that if proper due diligence was being employed, no one would have had an option of stealing my passport OFF THE SECURITY GUARDS DESK. I actually felt like causing an affray to just get arrested and then at least getting noticed, i sat there , in one chair for almost one day, with no phone/food/internet/money/contact with family (waiting for me at Heathrow, well, they were. I was then met by the head of Air India at the airport who asked me to relax and Air India would do everything in their power to get me home, starting with a trip to the High Commission in the morning and I was shown to a bed longer (where unfortunately building work was being conducted on the floor above, so no sleep there).
In the morning at about 7am I was greeted by a young, well turned out uniform - he had briefly spoken to me the day before and introduced himself (sorry I cannot remember your name) and he looked at me, held his hand out and said that my passport was in the possession of Air India - he went on to explain that the person was identified who took my passport and he was arrested at Birmingham International Airport where my passport was seized - given to the captain/cabin crew of the return flight and it was en route! four hours or so later I was reunited back with my passport (I can't tell you how that felt) I was then pulled to the front of a HUGE queue where I was asked which location I would like to fly back to in the UK - any destination and It would be taken care of by Air India - remember, this entire exercise was looked after by Air India, not security, not the airport, not the British Embassy - an airline - and to Air India, for their compassion and care - I am forever grateful. I arrived back in Heathrow where I literally wanted to kiss the tarmac!
